description: A large, rare macaw that is a uniform deep blue, similar to the Hyacinth but slightly smaller and with a greenish tinge. They have a teardrop-shaped yellow patch of skin at the base of their beak.
temperament: Intelligent, playful, and social. In the wild, they are very shy. In captivity, they can be affectionate but require experienced handling due to their rarity and specialized needs.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a powerful, rolling call similar to but higher-pitched than a Hyacinth's.
vocalization: Not well known for talking ability in captivity due to their rarity. Their natural calls are impressive and loud.
dietaryNeeds: A highly specialized diet, primarily consisting of Licuri palm nuts. Replicating this in captivity is challenging and requires a specific formulated diet.
healthPointers: Lifespan can exceed 60 years. Endangered and protected. Health care requires an avian specialist. Prone to PDD and other macaw-related illnesses.
housing: Requires a very large, custom-built aviary. They are not considered pet birds and are usually found only in conservation programs and zoos. Not suitable for private homes.
